TextView.android:text: Sheet E: Minor/Minor Crossroad Junction
Works Location
Are all roads at this junction MINOR Traffic
If any road is a MAJOR Traffic road, Refer
to Inspector.
Minor Traffic: Extremely low traffic volumes.
Typically no more than one moving vehicle
visible within 100m of the site, and
generally no HGV, bus traffic, or traffic signals.
Major Traffic: Any other traffic volume.
IF IN DOUBT, if there are more than 20 vehicles
passing in 3 minutes, it is Major Traffic.
Advance Warning Signs are required.
Signs to be placed on ALL approaches
so they are visible to traffic
AT LEAST 50 metres away.
Remaining Width on the Footway?
This is the width that will be left for
pedestrians AFTER the worksite is set up.
If Less than 1.2 metre is left on the Footway
a PEDESTRIAN WALKWAY on the road
is required.
Position of Works- Junction Section?
Using the diagram above, which section of the
junction are the works located in?
Red Section
Orange Section
Green Section
Blue Section
Roadway width Remaining?
The width that will be left on the roadway
AFTER the worksite is set up, including
pedestrian walkway if required, and a works vehicle.
Less than 6 metres
More than 6 metres
Roadway width Remaining?
The width that will be left on the roadway
AFTER the worksite is set up, including
pedestrian walkway if required, and a works vehicle.
Less than 6 metres
More than 6 metres

pedestrian walkway if required, and a works vehicle.

Traffic Management Plan
Pedestrian walkways Must be provided where
less than 1.2m is left on the footpath. These
are not shown for clarity.
Where a pedestrian walkway is required, set
up cones and signs as shown in the relevant
plan, and then set up walkway with suitable
barriers inside the cones.
